newsitem.title: BRAZIL: SOCCER-FOUR SENT OFF AS CRUZEIRO LOSE LEAD.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-FOUR SENT OFF AS CRUZEIRO LOSE LEAD.

text.p: Four players were sent off as Cruzeiro were knocked off the top of the Brazilian championship on Wednesday after losing 2-0 to lowly Parana in a bad-tempered encounter.
Both teams were reduced to ten men by halftime as Parana defender Edinho and Cruzeiro midfielder Ailton were given their marching orders for violent fouls.
Cruzeiro midfielder Fabinho and Parana's Carlos Alberto Dias were shown the red card in the second half for the same offence.
Dias had put Parana in front in the 50th minute before he was sent off and the game was settled three minutes from the end when Alissio scored again.
Guarani, second at the start of the day, also lost, 1-0 away to Atletico Mineiro, allowing Palmeiras to return to the top of the table with a 2-1 win over bottom club Bragantino.
Striker Viola scored his first goal since joining Palmeiras from Spanish club Valencia as the unbeaten championship favourites came from behind.
For the second time in four days, Flamengo suffered the humiliation of seeing one of their former players score a hat-trick against them.
Paulo Nunes, who began his career with Flamengo, scored all the goals for Gremio as they beat the beleagured five-times Brazilian champions 3-1 to go back into the top eight.

On Sunday, Flamengo were beaten 4-1 by arch-rivals Vasco da Gama with Edmundo, who played for them last year, scoring three times. Flamengo also lost 4-1 to Sao Paulo last week and have now slumped to eleventh place.
The top eight of the 24 teams go into the quarter-final stage.
Santos, runners-up last year, were jeered off the field after losing 2-1 at home to Sport Recife.
